summary: "Do the Right Thing" is a 1989 movie by Spike Lee about racial tension in a Brooklyn neighborhood. It focuses on an Italian-owned pizzeria and the African-American community. The story builds up to a tragic and violent climax on a hot summer day. The film was a hit with critics and audiences, earning awards and nominations, including an Academy Award nomination for Best Original Screenplay. It's now considered a classic, being selected for the National Film Registry and ranking high in lists of the greatest films.
title: Do the Right Thing
